_header: Mine own dear son and thou will lere
Title(s): A Father’s Instructions to his Son
Subjects: instruction, father to son; manners, treatises on; children, instructions for the behavior of
Bibliographic Ghosts: London, British Library Cotton Vespasian D.XIII: this MS has only 55 folios.
_description: A Father’s Instructions to his Son — 956 lines in couplets

BLCottVesDXIII.First Lines: Myne awen dere sone & þu will lereOf syndry wittis & þu will here…
BLCottVesDXIII.Last Lines: …And all þat herys or will it redeGoddis blissynge hafe thay to þer mede
BLCottVesDXIII.Note: Preceded by the end of a ME prose text of advice for nuns (f. 181).
BLCottVesDXIII.Editions:
Mustanoja,  Tauno F. 
             “Myne Awen Dere Sone.” 
             Neuphilologische Mitteilungen
         49 (1948): 149-79: 149-79.
